item.title: Namespace and scope
item.description: This is python offical document that explain the difference between Scope and Namespace. My summary after reading the document is as follows. What is namespace and scopeï¼Ÿ A namespace is a mapping from names to objects. Examples of namespaces are: the set of built-in names(containing functions usch as abs(), and built-in exception names); the global names in a module; and the localnames in a function invocation. In a sense the set of attributes of an object aloso form a namespace.
